author: {'steamid': '76561198233941008', 'num_games_owned': 2343, 'num_reviews': 2008, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1697412067}
review:
[h1]Jim Power - The Lost Dimension: Uma Ameaça Intergaláctica[/h1]

Introdução:
Prepare-se para embarcar em uma emocionante aventura intergaláctica em "Jim Power - The Lost Dimension". Neste jogo, você assume o papel de Jim Power, um agente especial, cuja missão é impedir que uma força alienígena sinistra chamada Vaprak destrua nosso mundo e o arraste para um vórtice dimensional.

Salvando o Mundo:
A trama se desenrola em um cenário futurista, onde a Terra é a última linha de defesa contra Vaprak, que ameaça mergulhar o universo em um abismo dimensional. Como Jim Power, você é a única esperança de salvar a Terra e a todos os planetas do multiverso que dependem dela.

Jogabilidade Intensa:
"Jim Power - The Lost Dimension" oferece uma jogabilidade desafiadora e cheia de ação. Você enfrentará uma série de inimigos alienígenas em sua jornada para impedir Vaprak. A ação é constante, e a dificuldade aumenta à medida que você avança nas fases.

Ambientes Incríveis:
Os cenários do jogo são variados e impressionantes. Desde paisagens alienígenas distantes até interiores de naves espaciais sinistras, a diversidade de ambientes manterá sua jornada interessante. Cada nível traz novos desafios e perigos.

Recomendação:
"Jim Power - The Lost Dimension" é um jogo que atrairá os fãs de ação e aventura espacial. Sua jogabilidade desafiadora e história envolvente o tornam uma escolha sólida para quem busca uma experiência de jogo intensa e cativante. Prepare-se para lutar contra as forças alienígenas e evitar a catástrofe dimensional em uma corrida contra o tempo. Jim Power está pronto para a batalha, e você deve ajudá-lo a salvar o mundo. É hora de mostrar suas habilidades e deter Vaprak antes que seja tarde demais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1696430455}
review:
Jim Power -The Lost Dimension is an ancient game from 1993.  It's a whopping 30 years old at the time of this review.  The game lacks support for any modern gaming display resolutions (or widescreen monitors), hasn't been modernised or updated to run smoothly on modern gaming PCs.  Despite this lack of modernisation, it carries a pretty high price tag for such an ancient game.  This seems to have been put on Steam as a nostalgia gouge.

This is really a poor "me too" platformer that failed to capture any attention from gamers even back in 1993... remember, PC gamers were enjoying games like DooM and Wing Commander back then... these guys were trying to push 2D platforming in the 3D renaissance... what a joke!  No wonder this was a failure back then. 

This game is so old it runs in DOSBOX and doesn't take advantage of hardware acceleration.  It has a dated control scheme, dated graphics, and runs poorly due to the DOSBOX emulation.  While DOSBOX is a fine tool for those seeking retro gaming, it's not really appropriate for ancient abandonware like this to be dumped on Steam without any modernisation, this is just a greedy cash grab from developers trying to get your money for dead software, they want to pay them a second time for a game you probably already owned.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this only appears around the same time that trading cards were applied to the game... so this is just card idlers getting their cards and moving on.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Jim Power -The Lost Dimension is relatively expensive for an abandonware nostalgia gouge, at UNKNOWN - 2650, and it's not worth it.  The game is just too old, hasn't been modernised.  And as the old saying goes, you can't go home again.  Even when it was new, this was never a triple-A game.  This is the kind of game that went almost directly from the warehouse into the cheap bargain bins at the front of the shop.  Now, on Steam, without any modernisation?  This is impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056976073', 'num_games_owned': 6040, 'num_reviews': 1653, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1674800590}
review:
1993년 DOS 및 SNES(슈퍼패미컴)로 발매된 고전 플랫포머+횡스크롤 슈팅.
저는 잘 모르지만 컬트적인 인기가 있는 건지, 무려 2021년에 제네시스(메가드라이브), NES(패미컴) 버전까지 냈습니다.
스팀판에서도 무료 업데이트로 추가해 줬기 때문에 이걸 사면 4가지 버전의 게임들을 모두 해볼 수 있습니다.

근데 게임이 넘 어렵고 올드하여.. 이 게임에 추억이 있으신 분 아니면 딱히 추천할 것까진 못되는 것 같네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011776928', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1673919457}
review: Still having problems using an Xbox controller with the DOS version BUT the inclusion of the SNES, Genesis and NES versions all playable on the Xbox game pad all made up for it! Thank you. After all this time I can now play this game with my game pad and I have 3 versions to play. Well done and thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198830766026', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 350, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1702544580}
review:
Довольно неплохая игра с весьма странной реализацией. Вам дается на выбор одна и та же игра в 4 разных лаунчерах, в каждом со своими плюсами и минусами. На мой вкус, в первом все выглядит еще более менее играбельно, хоть и подтормаживает, да и графика пиксельная. NES версия выглядит несколько допотопно по сравнению с другими, и более хардкорна, но тоже неплоха. В двух остальных [strike] скорость а..евающая [/strike] все насается перед глазами как блоха по ширинке, играть на пк в таком формате - удовольствие то еще.
Что же до самой игры - все и правда выглядит занятно. Приятная музыка, некоторая хардовость с прыжками и довольно живучими врагами. Ценителям, думаю, понравится

author: {'steamid': '76561199229800072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1644508956}
review:
Están las versiones de SNES (modificada para morir de 3 golpes en lugar de una), Genesis, DOS y NES. Las cuatro son muy parecidas pero hay suficientes diferencias para jugarlas todas a mi parecer.

Son juegos ambiciosos, con jugabilidad run and gun, navecitas y en los casos de SNES y DOS tamién hay dos niveles al estilo de la vista de arriba del genial Contra III.

La música es compuesta por el mismo músico de Mega Turrican y por lo tanto es de gran calidad. 

Del lado negativo es que la dificultad puede ser alta y que los niveles son tan largos que pueden volverse monótonos antes de terminarlos.

Aún así lo recomiendo (a duras penas)  gracias a la variedad de estilos de juego y música.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020626464', 'num_games_owned': 3251, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1507663277}
review: The Amiga version was a masterpiece. The versions included here were not. It's a crime the home computer versions are not included. An Amiga version with two-button support (no "axis up" to jump like in the original) would easily be the definitive way to play this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971028272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1634501576}
review: Dieses Spiel kann man leider nicht empfehlen. Man kann nur das ruckelige Remaster, oder was das sonst sein soll, mit dem Xbox Gamepad steuern, die SNES-Versionen - sowohl Original als auch Enhanced - reagieren nicht. Spart euch das Geld. Schade um diesen Retroklassiker.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970277027', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1465250803}
review:
Jim Power in of itself is not a great game. The SNES version runs more quickly than the DOS version, which sounds great, but it feels unintentional and too fast, which creates a lot of segments that require future knowledge to not die. The game's overall controls and level design point toward trial and error until the player has memorized the game enough to get to the end. The "Enhanced Version" tries to curve the game's inherent difficulty by implementing 3 hits per life, but does not save what is ultimately an unpleasant experience. On the other hand, the DOS version is more possible with its less ludicrous speed, but in turn makes the game feel worse  and less responsive to play.

This particular release runs the game on Piko's emulator. Unfortunately, this emulator doesn't read diagonal inputs, resulting in the player coming to a complete stop if inputting more than one direction(typically resulting in player death). This release also promised:

-Unreleased Sega Genesis version coming in future update

Future DLC-

-High Quality Soundtrack by Chris Huelsback!
-8 bit NES version!

that never released after its 5-some year release on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048038590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1631636545}
review: Wieder etwas für die Retro-Liebhaber, dieses mal ein Platformer. Ich habe das "Original" damals nicht gespielt, aber meiner Meinung nach ist dies ein guter Platformer, Storytechnisch nichts weltbewegendes, aber das Gameplay ist leicht zu lernen und macht Spaß. Also wer mal in alten Erinnerungen schwelgen möchte, kann gerne zulangen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023050632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1666821549}
review:
UPDATE 2/13/2022: I originally said that there was no promised NES and Genesis versions of Jim Power included in this package, but as of this year, Piko has finally released those versions. While the Genesis version is quite similar to the previous versions, the NES version is quite unique and I honestly prefer it over the other versions. It looks great and the music sounds awesome. It's highly recommended! I will keep my outdated reference in the review below just for my sake though.

---

Jim Power is an obscure platformer from the 90's that was originally released for several platforms including the Amiga and SNES. It has that Turrican vibe to it, which is funny, given the soundtrack being done by Chris Huelsbeck. It has some interesting gimmicks which were ambitious for the time, including a top-view level much like the ones in Contra 3, although far more interesting. It's challenging, and you'll know that from the second level, where you have to plan out your strategy on which keys to get first so you don't lock yourself from the rest of the level. Overall, a decent little romp that was overlooked, probably because of the vast amount of mascots or characters like this that were prevalent in the 90's.

This package from Piko is okay, but it definitely has issues. The DOS version runs on the DOSBox emulator, which I expected, but it seems like they didn't even properly configure it. The digitized sound effects are not present, and the framerate is really inconsistent, even on a very powerful machine like mine. The SNES version, much like Piko's other SNES re-releases, utilizes a re-badged version of the SNES9x emulator. It works fine, but it's very wonky trying to figure out the key bindings. Additionally, there is no word on the supposed Genesis and NES versions being released, though I do hear they will be released once the Kickstarter is completed for the physical versions, but don't take my word on that.

Overall, this is a fine little game, and I'm only giving the recommendation based on the game itself. Do not take it as a recommendation for this port. It can be playable if you modify some items, but if you just want it to work on the first time, then I would skip this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097314588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1590268943}
review: J'aime ce type de jeux que j'avais connu à l'époque. Il est assez typique de la scène européenne sur les jeux amiga/ST. Une très belle réalisation technique pour l'époque mais soyez prévenu la difficulté est dure, très dure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971947864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1587684460}
review:
Acheté et remboursé. 

Je déconseille les jeux 
DÉVELOPPEUR : Digital Concepts
ÉDITEUR : Piko Interactive LLC, Classics Digital

Certains se plaignent de DOTEMU alors que ces derniers respectent bien mieux les franchises rachetées avec un réel travail de fond.

Pour " JIM POWER - The Lost Dimension"
DÉVELOPPEUR : Digital Concepts
ÉDITEUR : Piko Interactive LLC, Classics Digital

( jeu culte des années 90 )

Je reproche une émulation simple avec le strict minimum.
Je regrette l'absence d'un enrobage globale afin de se sentir à l'aise.
Pas de menus permettant de modifier les touches, d'options graphiques, de changement de version de jeu à la volée . ..

GROS REGRET :
Je déplore l'absence d'options graphiques permettant entre autres de donner un cachet vintage avec image baveuse d'écran cathodique, et surtout des SCANLINES.
Pour les jeux rétros il y a des puristes comme moi qui recherchent cette sensation.
Je REGRETTE l'absence d'option graphique ajoutant des SCANLINES virtuelles.

J'aurai aimé recommander ce jeu, mais je suis contraint personnellement de me reporter sur une émulation standard en dehors du carcan STEAM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103916275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1584733629}
review:
Manchmal kommt es wirklich darauf an welche Version man spielt

Wenn es etwas gibt, was ich von Jim Power gelernt habe, dann die Tatsache, dass sowohl Konvertierungen als auch simpelste Eingriffe in ein und dasselbe Spiel einen gewaltigen Unterschied machen können. Während die SNES-Version aufgrund unnötiger Maßnahmen unspielbar schwer gemacht wurde, waren die DOS- oder Pikos Enhanced-Version recht unterhaltsam und spaßig.
Dementsprechend kann ich euch das Steam-Paket, welches neben der SNES-Fassung auch noch die DOS- und Enhanced-Version zur Verfügung stellt durchaus ans Herz legen. Vom reinen SNES-Modul lasst ihr aber besser die Finger, denn dieses wird euch nur Kummer bescheren und rückt den eigentlich soliden Actionhelden Jim Power nur in ein schlechtes Licht.


Pro und Kontra:

Pro:
- hervorragender OST von Chris Hülsbeck und schöne Soundeffekte
- bietet sehr viel Abwechslungsreichtum
- die Steam-Version bietet 3 verschiedenen Versionen für den schmalen Taler, guter Deal für Retro-Fans
- die Steam-Exklusive Enhanced-Version beseitigt die gröbsten Mängel der SNES-Version und macht diese endlich spielbar

Neutral:
- 7 Level die theoretisch in einer Stunde durchgezockt werden können

Kontra:
- das zu schnelle Parallax-Scrolling der SNES-Version sorgt bei vielen Spielern für Übelkeit
- viel zu hohe Spielgeschwindigkeit in der SNES-Version (die DOS-Version läuft z.B. nur mit halber Geschindigkeit)
- der Schwierigkeitsgrad der SNES-Version wurde künstlich in die Höhe gedrückt (nur 3 Leben und 3 Continues, die Lebenspunkte der DOS-Version wurden ersatzlos gestrichen)

review: I was always interested in both console and computer versions of games, even back in the NES & DOS era. This is a classic action game from the 16-bit era. I've wanted to play this when I had my x386 computer, now I have the chance. The enhanced SNES addition is great (good soundtrack too). I highly recommend this for nostalgia and for people to see and compare console and PC games.

ce n'est pas bon,

nous ont voulait juste farfouiller la rom et extraire les musiques.

et j'invite tous ceux qui comme moi ont senti se faire mettre une quenelle,

cordialement.

signé,
un acheteur bafoué parmi tant d'autres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063230655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1458137416}
review: Desplazamiento de paralaje en múltiples niveles, armas adicionales, Level Guard, en resumen, ¡todo lo que puedes esperar de un juego de plataformas hoy está disponible! Ahora debe quedar claro que Jim Power es más que una simple emulación del juego de SNES en la PC. Ni siquiera tengo que elogiar los coloridos gráficos y no debo enfatizar la banda sonora del Maestro Hülsbeck. ¡Todo esto junto con la opción de contraseña y los tres niveles de dificultad completan el juego y completan la acción divertida!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 1775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1775, 'last_played': 1550020402}
review:
Tags: Sidescroll Shooter
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Jarring sidescrolling that is displeasing to the eyes. Stiff jump animation. Enemies tank bullets. Cramped level design. Dated. NES versions dont have Xbox360 pad support.

This is an old nostalgia oriented small collection of Jim Power versions. The game itself looks like it could be a bit of fun if they had a working, maybe retweaked version, but then again the pixeljob is really starting to show its age and there are a ton of alternatives to this kind of gameplay. Altogether this just clutters the library. Archiving.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995083742', 'num_games_owned': 885, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 2977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1547609847}
review: Having played the original countless times on the Nintendo SNES since the 9yrs old, I was extremely delighted to find the port to Steam. Game-play & music is just as good as it was during the 90's. Also, this one brings a fantastic feeling of nostalgia and the extreme challenge that only the old-school players could face back then. Replaying this title brought back many memories as I relived my childhood on the Jim Power.  My God!... Yes, this is worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970934600', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1610138551}
review:
Ein schlechter Aufguss des alten.

Mangel-1)
Ich selber nutze den XBox360 Kontroller und war doch recht verwundert, das der nicht angnommen wurde, trotz Info, das der unterstützt wird. 
Mein Problem war, das ich mehrere Kontroller nutze am PC und z.B. meine Flugsteuerung ständig angeschlossen ist, dadurch musste man im Windows ERST den XBOX Kontroller als STANDART Kontroller defenieren, dann wird der auch 
angenommen vom Spiel. Sehr umständlich.

Mangel-2)
Ich kenne Jim Power noch vom Amiga und man konnte leicht Hüpfen und schießen gleichzeitig, in dieser Version ist das zwar auch möglich, aber es fühlt sich irgendwie falsch an weil die Belegung der Knöpfe einfach nur blöde ist. Man kann zwar die Buttons umbelegen (SNES Version), aber warum nicht gleich richtig und sinnvoll?

Naja, ich mag zwar Retro Games, da es meine Zeit war (C-64, Amiga, Mega Drive, Snes), dennoch sollte man nicht alles kaufen, was Recycled wird. Schade, da Jim Power damals einfach Top zu spielen war und richtig Spaß machte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014652260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1678972873}
review:
2018/12/28 に購入しましたが予定されているＤＬＣは何も実装されていないようです。
ＤＬＣとしてはジェネシス版や、Chris Huelsback氏のサウンドトラック、8ｂｉｔ－ＮＥＳ版？が予定としてあったようです。

ゲームはＤＯＳ版、ＳＮＥＳ版が収録されている。
ＤＯＳ版はライフ制へ変更されているバージョンのみ
ＳＮＥＳ版オリジナルとライフ制等仕様変更されているバージョンが選択できる

ＤＯＳ版はＤＯＳＢＯＸによる起動の為自分で設定を変更しないと動作がおかしかったりする。
そのままでは、ゲームの速度がおかしい、キャラクターの声が出ないなどあります。
そもそもライフ制へ無理矢理変更している為、地面の針に落ちてもすぐには死なず
死ぬのを待たないといけないなど不都合がある。

ＤＯＳ版ジムパワーはアミガの後に発売された後の物です。（ステージ等が追加されたりしている）
ＳＮＥＳ版はそれの演出等が強化されたバーション。

ちなみにＰＣエンジンはアミガ版の移植になっている。
ＰＣエンジンは移植の際に、難度の高い場所の敵を削除するなどして遊びやすくしてあります。

2022/2/12　アップデートでジェネシス版、NES版がプレイできるようになりました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198071753285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1545613263}
review:
First things first, the game itself is great! The problem comes with this release of the game. It includes the DOS and two variations of the SNES version (original and enhanced). As you'd expect the DOS versio uses DOSbox and controller support is fine, but whatever emulator they're using for the SNES version runs the game fine but doesn't have native controller support... really, Piko? On top of that the keyboard mapping is plain horrendous: ignoring which key is which respective SNES button, you jump with CTRL and fire with C...... WHO SERIOUSLY HTOUGH THIS WAS A PLAYABLE CONTROL SCHEME??? The game is a huge challenge, which is part of it's appeal, so confusing and cumbersome controls make it almost unplayable. 

Decided to try this release out since it included the DOS version, and apparently a planned update for the Genesis/Megadrive one. Piko's other releases are literally just them selling you a ROM, but here at least you get a package of the different versions to enjoy. Again, the game is great but this release is absolutely horrendous. Find another way to play it, unless you're OK exclusively playing the DOS version. Makes me wonder how bad the other SNES games from Piko control assuming they use the same emulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980002114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1485227220}
review:
If you want an unreasonably difficult game this is the one for you.
Even though it's one of the harder titles out there for its generation it's still one of my favorites, with excellent music and challenging levels it keeps you busy for hours while you learn to navigate each level.

Unfortunately however the person in charge of developing and updating this title hasn't done so. The "Future DLC" he promises hasn't been delivered in years and is likely never coming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960568549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1499828981}
review:
First off, ONLY consider buying this if you have some nostalgia for the game, because it is not a good game. It is the most unfair stupid hard junky platformer ever to grace your screen.

What it DOES have is the best video game soundtrack of all time. This is not up for debate, everyone who disagrees is in deep denial.

This package itself however does not have enough features to justify even the sale price, such as:

The Dos version is slow with inferior sound and music
The Enhanced SNES only contains some very minor tweaks
Genesis version has yet to be released
NES version has yet to be released
Does not have the original Jim Power game for Amiga/Turbografix
No high quality soundtrack

Just get your own emulator and ROMs for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034614210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1499543936}
review:
[h1]상도덕을 잊은 그야말로 시체 팔이 게임[/h1]

게임은 액션 게임 파트와 슈팅 게임 파트가 번갈아 가면서
진행된다는 점이 다소 독특하긴 하지만
딱 그 때 그 시절 고전 액션 게임 그 이상도 이하도 아니라서
20년 전 게임인 만큼 이 게임에 추억이 있는 분이 아니라면
이제 와서 굳이 일부러 해 볼 정도의 게임은 아닙니다

문제는 그것보다도 이 게임을 사서는 안 되는 이유가 있으니
말그대로 오리지날 PC버전을 그대로 넣어놨는지
무려 도스박스로 실행됩니다 (….)

슈퍼 패미컴 버전도 제공하기는 하는데 이쪽은 에뮬레이터를
통해서 실행되는 느낌이라 여러 가지 문제도 좀 있고 
깔끔하게 실행되는 건 아니라서 끔직한 건 마찬가지.

20년이 지난(2015년도 발매) 지금에 와서 다시 팔 생각이면
HD화까지는 아니더라도 최소한 최신 사양에 맞게 컨버전해주는 게
최소한의 예의라고 생각하는데 너무 날로 먹을 심산입니다.

더불어 미공개 메가 드라이브 버전이나 패미컴 버전 DLC 를 판다고
약만 잔득 팔아놓고 정작 개발사는 잠수 탄 상황이라
사후 지원도 기대할 수 없는 상황.

이런 게임은 애초에 관심도 주지 맙시다…..

author: {'steamid': '76561198099691620', 'num_games_owned': 1269, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1496309818}
review: Existe 3 laucher pra escolher, original, snes, original snes. As versões originais tem um grafico confuso ao fundo que atrapalha muito a visão do movimento do personagem. o grafico deveria ir pra traz, mas vai pra frente. É possivel usar controle xbox em apenas 1 dessas versões, nas outras só com controle original de snes. no teclado a posição dos botões está horrivel. inimigos não morrem facil e vem correndo em sua direção. tem que dar uns 10 tiros pro inimigo morrer. mas vc dá 3 tiros e o inimigo encosta em vc de tão rapido que eles são. não recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111811696', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1493583828}
review:
С родословной того, что продаётся на Стиме как "Jim Power -The Lost Dimension", сложно разобраться... Не верьте мне на слово, так как я не разобралась. Выскажу свои предположения.

По всей видимости, "Jim Power -The Lost Dimension" изначально аркадная игра (с игровых автоматов), которая должна была получить (или даже получила) порты на ПК и SNES. В наши времена компания Pico, которая переиздаёт, реставрирует и доделывает старые игры, выпустила в стиме версии для DOS и SNES вместе одним продуктом.

Что это значит для нас, в 2017+? Во-первых, управление рассчитано на игровой автомат, а не на геймпад или клавиатуру. Это когда нажимаешь кнопки, вмонтированные в панель, и двигаешь персонажа зажатой несколькими пальцами ручкой. Такое управление больше подходит файтингам и аркадным авиасимуляторам, чем платформерам. Оно больше рассчитано на планирование, чем на спонтанность - даже рефлексы под такие игры оттачиваются вдумчиво и преднамеренно. Аркадный платформер значительно проще своих консольных и компьютерных коллег, потому что игрок за панелью управления просто не может реагировать настолько же свободно. Это очень хорошо видно в Jim Power по тому, что враги и дизайн уровней топорные, а управление явно тугое и лишено привычной плавности.

Во-вторых, оригинальная игра вроде бы выпущена с какой-то 3Д-примочкой. Игровой автомат был устроен так, что происходящее на экране было выпуклым и многослойным - во всяком случае что-то такое обещалось в рекламе. Этим объясняется очень странное движение фона в версиях для DOS и SNES. Фон будто опережает персонажа, как если бы всю игру он оббегал огромный столб. В аркадной версии с 3Д-эффектом, возможно, это было как-то впечатляюще, примерно как летяющие в кинозал объекты фильма, но при обычной игре очень отвлекает. К стимовской версии прилагается доработанная версия для SNES, где опережающий фон заменён обычным и довольно красивым параллакс-эффектом. Какое облегчение! Но это всё равно припарка игре, которую вынули из игрового автомата, но не вынули игровой автомат из неё.

Захотите ли вы играть в порт аркадной игры, плохо адаптированной для компьютера? В которой сложность (в версии для SNES - одна из высочайших на платформе) обеспечивается тугим управлением? Я думаю, нет.

P.S. Оказывается, игра изначально была не на аркадный автомат, а на домашние компьютеры (до современного стандарта PC). Это тоже объясняет тугое управление: оно шло с клавиатуры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012601434', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 158775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96383, 'last_played': 1704220588}
review: Vaprak threatens to defeat our world which is the last planet that stands between him and a dimensional vortex. This vortex leads to a fifth and, up until now, lost dimension. If he succeeds in defeating us, he will destroy our world, opening a gateway for his kind as well as the strange mutating effect that this dimension has on all organic life forms. His forces are far too strong for us to defeat in a frontal attack which is why I was sent to slip past his Omni-eye scanners and make an assassination attempt on the greatest evil that man has ever known. It will take absolutely all of my wits and skill but it is imperative that I reach his fortress and send him back to the sulfurous plane from whence he came.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253708044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1709315667}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049987475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1498447234}
review:
With the original Jim Power: The Lost Dimension being my favorite SNES game, I was very surprised and amazed to see this game being sold here and with other things included! The DOS version is a very nice add-on as I'm sure many people haven't experience that version, and the "Enhanched" version of the SNES game is a nice variant for an even challenging version of an already brutally challenging game!

It is a shame the original Amiga title Jim Power in Mutant Planet isn't included, but considering this is all related to "The Lost Dimension" port of the game, I can see why it wasn't. Still I would love to see Piko release the original and all the ports from that one like the Amstrad CPC and PC-Engine releases. And with the addition of the unreleased SEGA Genesis version coming soon, a High Quality version of the OST from Chris Hulsbeck , and the NES homebrew version, it's worth it!

Edit: A shame all the extra stuff to come later never came to this release, as Piko did a Kickstarter last year to release physical versions of this game which included the NES homebrew version and finished version of the Genesis prototype that was mentioned to be here. I did support the Kickstarter and was very surprised to see it all happen and it was pretty worth it for that, but as far as this release, just keep in mind you're only getting the DOS version and the SNES variants here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987798399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1709498851}
review:
Les versions AMIGA et SUPER NINTENDO de JIM POWER sont de vrais bijoux, ça c'est une chose indéniable. Elles font toutes deux parties de mes jeux favoris et je me refais une petite partie de temps en temps (pas sur la version STEAM J'avoue). Le rythme, la musique et les beaux graphisme, j'aime cet univers règlé au petits oignons.
Cependant, je dois avouer que les versions présentes sur STEAM sont indigestes. Décevantes! au niveau de l'émulaton.
Je recommande malgré tout l'achat de cet article parce que j'espère que si les ventes se font plus nombreuses, on aura droit à une mise à jour de grande ampleur.
D'un autre côté, si nos programmeurs préférés daignaient se remuer le popotin, on pourrait avoir des versions superbement retranscrites, avec du FULLHD, du VSYNC et quelques filtres graphiques... Et un vrai support manette SVP.
En l'état, il y a peu de chance pour que le jeu se vende mieux si rien n'est fait du côté des programmeurs et il semblerait qu'il y ait peu de chance pour que les programmeurs améliorent leur produit s'il n'y a pas plus de ventes. On est dans une impasse.
Moi je dis quand même que ce jeu a le potentiel pour être une référence encore aujourd'hui mais que c'est la manière dont il est vendu qui l'empêche d'être au box office.

review:

Team up with Jim "James" Power on a quest to stop ?bad? dogs and soldiers from patrolling spike filled death traps in this 1993 classic 2D game.

Summed up in a word, Jimmy Power is a stiff game.  Movement and shooting feel lethargic.  Both are compounded by the poor use of screen space that causes enemies to pop out in front of the player with limited time to react.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7466, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1461219727}
review: A gold-tier handling of retro games, comes with each port of the title and a "remastered" take. A lovely classic action game given new life in a literal three dimensions. Go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091795564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1711773199}
review:
Jim Power is not a very good game, yet it is still worth playing for it's quirky charms (and yes, excellent soundtrack.)

I definitely admire Piko's effort to make the stupendously awful SNES version *somewhat* playable, and I think they've actually succeeded. That said, the game is still more suited for a long, exacting and gruesome game design autopsy rather than any actual jump-and-shoot 16-bit fun; but that's at least a possibility now. Don't even bother with the SNES original unless you have a nearby toilet or sink to vomit into.

Once you've had your fill of laughing at all the hilariously emasculating ways ol' Jim bites it on just the first stage (death by water droplet, death by moist dog nose, etc.) in that, you can safely move on to the DOS version, which is not only graphically superior, it's infinitely closer to a polished and playable game. It's still quirky, odd and a bit off-kilter; but there's less annoying obstacles in the way of your potential platforming fun.

I also really have to commend Piko just for offering multiple ports of JP - it shouldn't be lost on younger generations that the same game was often wildly different on varying home computers and consoles. Thanks for giving customers some bang for their buck in a retro re-release! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198142267132', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1467499389}
review:
A game for oldschool and hardcore players. Have many of both of the good and bad points of the early 90's games, with different styles of playing in the same game. Nice graphics, great music, hard difficult, a character that just looks how an 90's character should look. Give it a try. Irt worth it.

Um jogo para jogadores oldschool e hardcore. Possui muitos dos pontos positivos e negativos dos jogos da primeira metade dos anos 90, com diferentes estilos de jogo presentes no mesmo título. Bons gráficos, ótima música, dificuldade alta, um personagem que se parece com aquilo que um personagem dos anos 90 deve parecer. Vale a pena dar uma chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961150231', 'num_games_owned': 2891, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1456682888}
review:
I also covered this game on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GL-keuI9nso

This is an old-school platformer mash-up title that many probably haven't heard of. It was more popular in Europe but not so much in North America. It blends together side-scrolling action, top-down action and shoot em' up levels into the same game, something very different and ambitious for the time. None of these are shining examples of their respective genres but they're all competently done. There's a lot of content here compared to many 90s era platformers, especially PC platformers. This game is rock hard though and only suited for those who enjoy a significant challenge and/or want to practice a lot to iterate their progress.

Unfortunately, this collection is a technical mess and isn't even worth $5 in the state Piko Interactive shipped it in, especially since as of this writing, they seemed to have stopped supporting or talking about it. It includes the MS-DOS and SNES versions of this game, as well as an "enhanced" SNES version, which is essentially a ROM hack that adds more life points and removes the double parallax scrolling which is hard on the eyes. Unreleased Genesis and NES versions were promised to be added as free DLC but these are nowhere to be seen and status is unknown.

The MS-DOS version uses the DOSBox emulator and is improperly configured when first installed from Steam. In order to get the digitised sound effects, you have to manually edit the DOSBox configuration file (instructions are in the Steam forums.) It also runs at a very inconsistent frame rate with awful screen tearing, even on my overclocked Core i7 machine. Other DOSBox games which are properly configured run like butter on this machine. This has never been fixed. You're charging money to provide the optimal way to play this game. If your users have to fix it for you, you shouldn't be charging for it.

The SNES versions use a re-badged implementation of what looks like the Snes9x emulator and while it runs at a much better frame rate and with better sound, it doesn't have proper XInput support. Trying to use an Xbox One controller results in the game thinking that B is being constantly pressed and even after rebinding the controls manually, I couldn't fix it. Playing with an old Xbox 360 controller worked fine and the DOS version of the game works fine with an Xbox One controller. Unacceptable in a 2015 release.

I would have refunded this game if I hadn't had it in my collection for months before I finally got around to playing it. Jim Power is an interesting historical series that platformer fans will like but in this state, with the lacking promised content and near silence from Piko Interactive for the last several months, you should not buy this package. If they ever get around to fixing it, optimising it and adding in the promised missing content, maybe then but not before. This is the last thing I'll be buying from this company.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008138205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1445378105}
review:
Jim Power is a classic, hard as nails, action platform shooting title that retro gaming fans will enjoy way into the night.  The recent trend of "pixel" art style games are because of titles like Jim Power- while super detailed, the graphics are still able to hold up due to trends in gaming today.  What is even cooler is, right now, you get three games with one purchase in this deal.

PC version- original title, full of challenge.
SNES version- port of the PC title.
SNES Enhanced version- Piko made some adjustments to the SNES original, reworked a few things and added little stuff here and there.  All around, this is the version to play.

Doesn't matter which version you play though, if you want a quality challenge then play Jim Power.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011146172', 'num_games_owned': 1256, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1508094323}
review:
Jim Power - The Lost Dimension isn't new its a re-release and you get 3 different versions of the game.  You get the DOS, SNES original and a SNES enhanced version.  Essentially the enhanced version just uses filters to give it a more HD look and the SNES Original is a less defined version that you remember playing on the SNES.  

There is a minor issue that is fixed by manually changing the graphics settings to higher performance as well as turning on V-Sync which will fix the problems with screen tearing.  Okay so how about the game play well it features two different genre's in one game.  You get  action sidescrolling platforming and a side scrolling shmup which is much like your favorite arcade counterparts.  

The great part of this is that the game has an amazing difficulty setting but the DOS version and SNES are different.  The DOS version is a lot slower which makes it a lot easier and the SNES version is a lot faster and is a lot more difficult.  But hey both games are still quite difficult its just I find the DOS version a lot more easy to handle.  

The music in the game is outstanding and if you know Chris Huelsback you'll know he has done music for a lot of classics which include Turricane, The Great Giana Sisters and he is now producing new music for newer games like The Giana Sisters Twisted Dreams and more so check him out.  I usually don't know how to review sound effects but hey they sound great for the 16bit genre of gaming with all the classic slashing sounds and explosion sounds you remember. 

I haven't fully completed the game and its one of those games your going to have a very hard time completing but hopefully the DOS version will make things a lot more easier for you.  Its still a very fun game and something you should have in your collection if your a fan of retro gaming. 

Check out https://www.pikointeractive.com/ for more information on some new and amazing classic games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970737065', 'num_games_owned': 3647, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1471389256}
review:
Nothing more than a handful of emulated versions of the game.

For the price, and for what it is, I'd expect EVERY version of the game, including the original "Jim Power in Mutant Planet" releases, which this was essentially a remix of. I mean, not even the original Amstrad CPC version, or the popular Amiga version was included.

As for the game itself, it's a fairly enjoyable, if frustratingly hardcore platformer, which is saved from the pit of mediocrity by the fantastic soundtrack by the legendary Chris Hulsbeck.

I can't really recommend it for £4 as it stands, but if it ever drops into a sale, or if the "developers" release other versions as free DLC at some point down the road, then sure, pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979911480', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1672964274}
review: This game rocked the gaming industry near 1992 for the Amiga as it was a great and challenging hardcore game. The other ports added some additional features and Health Points, which wasn't featured on the Original Amiga version. You should also check Chris Huelsbeck's soundtracks as he is one of Amiga's legendary composer.
